action.action-desc: Ms. Mace introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To improve the infant formula supply chain, and for other purposes.

section.text: During the 90-day period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act, and notwithstanding any other provision of law, no duty shall be imposed with respect to the importation of any infant formula product.

section.header: Study on feasibility of infant formula distribution centers remaining open for 24 hours a day
section.text: The Comptroller General of the United States shallâ€”

paragraph.text: study the feasibility of food infant formula distribution centers remaining open for 24 hours a day and any corresponding impacts to supply chains, including to determine whether keeping such centers open 24 hours a day would contribute to increasing the flow of goods and products to store shelves and final points of sale; and
not later 30 days after the date of enactment of this Act, complete such study and submit to the Congress a report on the results of such study.
